subject: Re: [junit] Why can't the JUnit3 GUI Runner run JUnit4 tests?
msgSnippet: /c/jdk1.5/bin/java -classpath ../classes;junit.jar;junit-4.0.jar Won t the above classpath command mean that JUnit 3.8.x is picked up by the classpath loader
messageBody:
/c/jdk1.5/bin/java -classpath "../classes;junit.jar;junit-4.0.jar"

Won't the above classpath command mean that JUnit 3.8.x is picked up by
the classpath loader before JUnit 4.x? I'd be interested to know if this
is indeed the case.

Regards,

Steve.

--
Stephen Smith, MEng (Wales).
http://www.stephen-smith.co.uk/

David Saff wrote:
> tietyt wrote:
>> Here is the command I'm using to run the JUnit3 gui runner:
>> /c/jdk1.5/bin/java -classpath "../classes;junit.jar;junit-4.0.jar"
>> junit.swingui.TestRunner
>
> What happens if you drop junit.jar off your classpath? All of those
> classes should also be in junit-4.0.jar, so it's unnecessary, and having
> two copies of the classes might be the problem. Let us know if that
> changes anything.
>
> David Saff
